result.execSummary:
The defendant Waymon R Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 2 days granted if revoked.
Consecutive to: 14CM1642
Court will allow early termination of probation after 18 months if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

No violent contact with victim.  Anger Management to be determined by Agent.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Waymon R Jackson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court conducts plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions. 2 days of credit. STAYED CONSECUTIVE to 2014CM1642
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $343.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Cash Bail to be refunded to poster
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. No violent contact with victim. Anger Management to be determined by Agent.  

Court will allow early termination  of probation after 18 months if all conditions have been met. 

CONDITION TIME: 30 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at Agents discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Waymon R Jackson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Waymon R Jackson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is trying to obtain a job.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent/abusive contact with the victim or anyone else. He must conduct a work seach, 5 jobs contacts a week.  Defendant must post $150.00 cash and sign a $1000.00 signature bond.

Defendant is not to have any violent/abusive contact with the victim or anyone else. He must conduct a work seach, 5 jobs contacts a week.  Defendant must post $150.00 cash and sign a $1000.00 signature bond.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Waymon R Jackson in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton for  Jorge R Fragoso.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
